videoTitle: How to Scale Up When You’re Stuck Between Early and Growth ｜ Postscript, Alex Beller

that's paid off for us where we've been

lines up as possible
so there's a common framing that I hear
from a lot of other late stage Founders
or investors that I believe is true
which is that every time your company
doubles in headcount size it breaks and
I've really seen that to be the case you
know when it's 10 people everyone's
connected to everyone and it's all
automatic and then suddenly it's 25
people and you need management layers of
some kind and then it's 50 and it's a
completely different company and 100 and
200 they're totally different companies
and they require different styles of
communication and man agement and they
require a lot of different things from
their Founders when you advance to the
growth stage the people challeng is
really set in your organization becomes
so much more about how you can direct
the resources at your disposal instead
of how can you as a Craftsman or a
practitioner build product or work with
customers and those are very different
skill sets when I think about some of
the biggest lessons or tips that I could
give entrepreneurs thinking about
scaling uh what comes to mind more than
anything else is values when we started
the business we didn't create a set of
values and the reason for this was
because we'd all worked in companies
before that you know had values but
maybe they weren't that important or you
know they just they hung on the wall but
no one really knew them or was connected
to them and so we just thought it was
Superfluous but Tim Brady who was one of
our partners at y combinator when we
were about to hire our first team member
he said to us create a couple values
it'll help you anchor the culture in
something and that's what we did the
three of us sat down and we banged our
head against the wall and we got the
Whiteboard out and we created a set of
values that value set has been core to
the culture that has been built a
postcript for now almost 7 years the key
tip that I would give people is not just
to create a set of values but to make
sure it has a great acronym this is
actually the hack because what's more
important than what the values are it's
that everyone knows them like the
specific things I'm sure everyone can
pick inspirational good values but
what's more important is just that
everyone can remember them and that they
uh reflect how you believe work should
occur so to get specific the values at
postcript the acronym for them is Fe Fe
it's kind of a funny word it's f a c h
it's Fearless
Excellence animal customer first
humility every time a new person joins
postcript they go through a training
with me where I walk them through all of
our values what Fe stands for the story
behind each one how we believe it should
show up at work and then people get
recognized for living these values and
it comes up in their annual reviews and
we have a slack Channel going where
people get shouted out for living within
these values and that has really helped
guide our culture and keep us all
together as we've grown remotely but I
believe that the values that are going
to be relevant to an organization are
going to change over time they're not
always the same I'll give you an example
the e in Fe of our company's values
today it stands for excellence it didn't
always stand for that it used to stand
for 8020 8020 meaning we wanted people
to be operating from an 8020 mindset we
didn't want folks to focus on Perfection
we wanted to be moving really quickly we
wanted to be doing whatever we could to
capture as much value as we can with 20%
of the effort and then move on to the
next thing and that was great that
helped us move quickly and that helped
us inform how we built product and that
helped us inform how we built process
and that was an amazing early stage
value I mean I would recommend it to
many folks but after a while we realized
we were running into issues because of
it we were well past 100 people and we
needed more robust processes and systems
we needed our product to be sturdier and
more stable right and less about just
shipping everything that's new and
making sure what we had was really
robust as we were serving bigger and
bigger customers and at that point we
went in and we changed the value from
8020 which starts with an E to
Excellence which also starts with an E
and that way the acronym for our value
stayed the same but we got to change the
DNA of the company and we haven't done
that many times it's probably happened
three times but each time it's been
really valuable and it's kind of a weird
quirky little learned secret but I would
really recommend other entrepreneurs as
they as they're scaling think about

going back and changing your company
